caption: Beautiful decor, exquisite food and great service! Every time I’ve come to Ernesto’s the food has always been delicious!  The menu changes with the ingredients in season, so every time I go I always find something new to eat. However, I do wish some dishes would be permanent as they are too delicious to only have once! On tus occasion we had the asparagus which were cooked to perfection, the shrooms with eggs and the Reuben bikini as appetizers. We then had the rice with mushrooms which was exquisite. It’s always a pleasure to dine here. Ernesto’s is a neighborhood favorite.
Found it by accident,  only had small plates but people are super friendly and food was great.

Perfection. Honestly, one of the most amazing dining experiences I've ever had. The staff was knowledgeable, friendly, and super cool. The food was bar none and the drinks were an experience unto themselves. The ambience of it all, the phenomenal selection of wine, vermouths, aperitifs, and digestifs paired with delicious basque inspired food was unforgettable. I almost want to go again, one day later. Buen Provecho!

The best of the best!!! Everyone at Ernesto’s make you feel like family and they are all so caring and knowledgeable about the cuisine, menu, and experience. The food is always perfect, thoughtful, and innovative. Alex and Davitta and Chef Ryan have created the most magical restaurant and you should RUN there with your friends and family ASAP!
I felt like I was eating at a Michelin Star restaurant and the service was incredible! The staff was wonderful and made sure we were happy with our dishes.

It was my 2nd time here, and both times have been very memorable dining experiences. It’s always a good sign when a restaurant is focused on its unique point of view on a specific cuisine. You can’t get this type of Spanish food anywhere else. So decadent yet comforting. The staff is extremely friendly and it feels like you’re eating/drinking with friends beyond your table. And they have their heat lamp game on point. I recommend frequent visits to this restaurant.

Outstanding menu & service. The tripe and rabbit were out of this world and the wine list was more than reasonable. Outdoor dining in Feb. was perfectly comfortable but all I can think about is returning in Summer to pair the paleta Iberico c/ patatas fritas y huevos with a cold Mahou. Kudos to you, Ernesto's staff! A+
Great food and service!
Very high quality food and clean. I definitely recommend if you are around the area.
food is good

Ernestos is one of my favorite go-to restaurants when friends or family are visiting NYC. I love the food and atmosphere. I've also found the staff and ownership to be respectful and responsible during Covid-times which is important for me when deciding to dine in somewhere. Can't wait to get back.

Been here several times and each time the experience has been truly exceptional. Amazing service, incredible food, the kindest and loveliest staff. The food and drinks are nuanced, creative, and sophisticated, and I’ve never met a friendlier or more generous team. Love this place.

Definitely worth the visit . Not cheap but special . Service is attentive and warm . Cocktail list elaborate ( pricey though) . Dishes delicious . Highly recommending the delicious salad (eggs cooked to perfection, dressing is ideal ).  The outdoor dining at night pleasant as the street is quiet .
delicious authentic spanish food, incredible decor/ambiance, friendly staff and located in a very cool part of the city. A quintessential NYC dining experience. Will be back soon!

I was taken back by the decor of the restaurant, so sleek and inviting and don’t get me started in their food. Each dish is crafted to perfection with love in every bite. Perfect place to wine and dine any night of the week. Lovely staff with an outstanding ambiance, will be back very soon!
Highly recommend Ernestos. Talented chef making amazing food. Great ambiance and awesome staff !

From the moment we walked into Ernesto's, we felt so welcome by the staff. The service was incredible and they were beyond accommodating. We started with the Paleta Iberico con Chips and Croquetas de gallina and also devoured the Arroz Meloso de Conejo. Overall, dining at Ernesto's was an extremely memorable experience and we highly recommend going! Great staff, great food and even better vibes! We cannot wait to go back!
Hospitality walks hand in hand with this delicious and adventurous menu. From the wine to the pinxtos - Ernesto’s has it all.
Worst Restaurant in new-York, don't waste your money...

Ernesto's was nothing short of a perfect NYC dining experience. From the moment you are greeted at the door, to a personal visit from the head chef at your table, and how can you forget the desserts! Always a great time!

Ernesto’s is an amazing experience during these dark times. The food is so delicious and the staff if the best. Their outdoor dining keeps in mind the safety of all patrons and staff by asking everyone to wear a mask when not eating. Unlike recent reviews on this page, the staff asking me to do this made me feel safe. Anyone who is complaining about COVID 19 protocols is just being selfish. Thank you to Ernesto’s and I will be back very soon!!

The dishes are authentic yet original and incredibly delicious. The service and employees are warm and inviting. The space is absolutely gorgeous. I really can’t say enough about Ernesto’s - we love it and highly recommend!!!

Had a terrible experience and owners were extremely unprofessional. Its a shame to treat customers the way they did, especially when people are trying to help support small business by showing up and accepting any accommodations (in this case, outdoors with no heaters when it was freezing). we were  told over the phone that the outdoors was comfortable.  We were screamed at by the owner while we were eating to stop eating and put our masks on when a waiter was at our table, repeatedly. They used their owner power on us in an abusive way and requested these rules from no one else but us. Its unfortunate because the food was good. And will definitely not be returning to this restaurant anytime soon.

Went with a group of friends...On the positive side the food was good and the wait staff was extremely nice and friendly. Despite this, and the main reason why I am giving 1 star is because the owners were extremely aggressive and rude. I completely understand these are tough times and it is important for all restaurant customers to be respectful of the rules and help protect the staff as well but the aggressive tone and constant interruption from the owners made the experience unbearable (especially sitting outside in the cold with 1 heater for a table of 10 that barely worked..which we were fine with and didn't complain about because it is tough times...). When you have a tapas style restaurant and a large group of people eating and drinking and wait staff coming and going constantly it is very difficult to take on and off a mask in time all the time. I recommend being clear about this rule from the beginning as most restaurants do not have it (we did not hear about it till being yelled at by one of the owners) while also coming up with a smarter system where the waiters wait a few seconds away from the table until everyone has their masks on + also doing fewer "runs" to the table itself - it is very difficult to stop eating/drinking/conversing every few minutes especially in a large group.  Finally - one of the owners calling one of the people in our group an "awful person" and continuing to argue is also not professional - this is NYC sometimes you are going to get people that speak their minds in a way that you might not like but as a business owner you just can't react like that and cross the line of name calling a customer.

Well well well... what is there left to be said about such an establishment. When I tried the duck I almost melted like the rendered fat upon my lips . The atmosphere for a Covid set up was great! I felt snug and safe with my party of 4. , the waiter we had was a consummate professional, he remembered every little detail of my sometimes notably annoying requests ... I can’t leave this review without mentioning the tortilla with the potatoes . It was like nothing I’d had ever had before. I could eat one of those for lunch daily. Besides that we went a little risqué and tried shrimp tempura at a Spanish place that turned out to be one of the best decisions we’ve made at a restaurant as a group of self proclaimed foodies !! All in all Erenestos was a 10/10 experience I would go back again and will be back again, I follow their instagram and saw they deliver soooo yeah... about that potato tortilla!

I LOVE ERNESTOS! Everything from the high quality food to the attentive friendly service. I have never had a bad time when dining at Ernestos. If you are unfamiliar with food from the Basque region of Spain, I recommend asking the waitress or hostess for a suggestion, but you can’t go wrong! And don’t forget the gourmet desserts!

Doesn’t happen often that I take the time to leave reviews, but I give credit where it’s due; plain and simple, Ernestos is a heaven of authenticity. The dishes are perfectly crafted showcasing a perfect blend of ingredients to bring you flavors of basque region that seem to be hard to find, even in nyc. Tip my hat off to chef and the team. Superb job. Love the way you have adapted to outdoor dining as well, the vibe helps a lot! Always nice to such gems
The food and ambiance at Ernesto’s is truly top notch. Amazing date and/or celebratory environment. But I also go to Ernesto’s cafe on a regular basis for my morning joe and love it as well.

Terrible owners. Covid times did not even help them find a heart and decency. The food itself was impeccable and the sommelier was the only kind human in there. But I have never in my life been treated so poorly. And to be very honest, felt discriminized against. Me and my group were completely discriminated upon by the two sisters Niakani. Completely disrespectful, abusive behavior and repeated hurtful harassment. We were basically not allowed to remove our masks at any point in time, not matter if our food was there or not. As long as a waiter was in the area of our table, even further away than 6 feet from us, we had to stop eating to wear our masks and had to endure one of the two owners interrupting us to ask us to mask up because a waiter was not far way. They put us outdoors with no heaters even though I had previously called to understand how the outside was set up to help me and my party plan how many  layers we would wear. Their response to my question on the phone was that they were well equipped with heaters, had a full night last night and full tonight so that should be good enough for us to believe their outdoors is well setup. Anyway, all in all terrible experience. Shame. Big big shame.  Also. Please see se responses to my IG complaint's response by one of the owners below.  Shame.
i recommend the poached pears, macaroni, hake, croquettes, and stuffed peppers
Beautiful bar with outdoor seating and good drinks. Also an excellent coffee shop in the morning, with delicious cappuccinos.

I have never written a review in my life because i’ve never been mistreated like this before. Can’t believe the owner of the restaurant is the most unprofessional business owner I have ever encountered. Thank god for the waitress for making the experience palatable.

What a night! We so enjoyed our dinner here - made special by the charming and knowledgeable team and ohhhh the food! Standouts: Gildas, Croquetas, Morcilla, Tortilla, Lentils & Foie, Creme Caramel. Beautiful wines & vermouths. Can't wait to go back.
The most increíble food and experience. I you want to taste the real flavors of Spain and The Basque Country you must visit Ernesto’s!!

The people at Ernesto's are fantastic, so friendly, warm and welcoming.  We mixed up our reservation and they made an extra effort to find us a table. Everything we had was mazing, really delicious rabbit with rice, and the pork collar was so tender.  We ended with the trifle, so indulgent and delicious.  I will definitely plan on coming back here again.

If you’ve ever been to Spain, or even eaten Spanish food in London, paying this much for such mediocrity is probably best avoided. On the positive side the tortilla is reasonable as was the glass of sherry. Blood sausage with pumpkin and tuna with onions were both tasty and interesting, but not good enough to inspire a return visit. The mushroom salad was over salted, unpleasantly dresses lettuce with a couple of mushrooms underneath it. The addition of chocolate to basque style cheese cake was unnecessary, the croquetas were bland and oddly hollow. But the service was great, so if you live in the area and think $19 for a glass of nice Chardonnay is reasonable (the txakoli tasted like it had been open for at least a week) it’s a nice place to drink and have the occasional nibble. If you are looking for a delicious meal you could do so much better.

We stopped by this appealing-looking restaurant to read the menu posted in the glass panel next to a closed door. We were accosted by a member of staff and informed were were standing too close and would have to leave the area. This is not how I would attract customers; goodness knows how caustic the ‘service’ is likely to be from such entitled brats.  ________________________________________________________________________  We note your comments in response, but also note that some clarification of facts that would otherwise interfere with the perspective of your response would serve the interests of acccuracy:  1. Your hostess was nowhere near the door, let alone within four feet. She spotted us and made her way across the restaurant to 'accost' us.  2. We were standing on a public thoroughfare over which you do not have the jurisdiction to dictate mask wearing. Her actions exceeded her authority and were found offensive.  If you have a problem with non-mask wearing members of the public enjoying the legitimate use of the sidewalk within four feet of your hostess;  a) move the menu, b) move the hostess c) move the sidewalk  Regardless, we wish you the best of luck. Marcus
Yummy food with a good variety of small plates, including a great lamb dish and wines to wash it all down. Lots of outdoor seating so plenty of space between tables so you feel comfortable.
An exquisite taste of Basque cuisine.  It's a little tricky to get in, and make sure you save up, but the food and service here are absolutely divine!
Quite a special place. My wife and I love Sherry, Spanish cuisine and a good design. Ernesto had all three of those. We enjoyed sitting outside as well which became very pretty as the sun went down.
Top-notch! Can't wait to sit inside.

Disclaimer: this review is based on the general Spanish food scene in New York City, NOT THAT IN SPAIN!!! TWO COMPLETELY DIFFERENT STANDARDS!!!!  I would say that Ernesto’s is definitely the best Spanish restaurant so far in NYC, along with the improved food quality in Mercado Little Spain. The price is definitely at the higher end, so please keep that in mind if you decide to go.  What I like: 1. croquetas (you know it’s gonna be good when the bechamel inside is moist and oozy, the outside is crunchy and crispy) 2. tortilla de patatas!!!! (This one is a must. The best tortilla so far in nyc I’ve ever had. The inside is oozing out when you cut it. Hella good. Gotta give this 12/10) 3. Callos madrileños (no explanation needed) 4. Milhojas (riquísimo!!!) 5. Pork collar (ibérico pork, no need to explain) 6. Gildas (this one is good, but needs more olive oil 7/10) 7. Patatas con paleta de jamón (chips are crispy, reminds me of Spanish aperitivo)  What I don’t like: 1. Txistorra - outer needs to be CHARRED more, por favor 2. Ensalada de tomate - Where is the salt? Where is the olive oil??? 3. Escabeche - we were expecting the classic escabeche (like the one prepared with perdiz)  We didn’t order pan con tomate but gotta say that it looks good. Service was ok, could be better and more efficient. We definitely did not appreciate the 20% gratuity added to our bill.
WHAT A FRIENDLY PLACE!  Food was delicious!
(Translated by Google) The. Very efficient service  (Original) El. Servicio muy eficiente
Great service, mediocre food for the price

Incredibly tasty food! I wish portions were a bit bigger for the price you pay, but you can tell all ingredients are high quality and that the chef really thought of each of the dishes! Please keep the flan always on the menu - the day I went it wasn’t available and I would have loved to try it!
Great place to go
Great food. Great ambiance and staff
Delicious food, safety space patio dining. The beverages are all great, although they only have a beer and wine license.  The iberico ham chips, croquettas and gildas were delightful.
Just had wine but it was great. The service was great too. Looking forward to having dinner. We'll be back. It may become our local hangout.
it's super delicious, great staff but watch out for the final bill $$

Amazing Spanish food,  please ask for the pan con tomate it is delicious!  I got a little bit disappointed about the chips with prosciutto because the chips tasted a little old and soggy. So maybe you have better luck!  But the drinks are good, and the staff are kind.
An experience you need to see for yourself beautiful great scenery and most important great sevice

Ernesto’s is the upscale experience this neighborhood needs. I’ve seen it bustling from the outside and finally planned to check it out. The experience was worth it.  I had the `BISTEC CON SALSA OPORTO` and `ENSALADA ERNESTO` which we’re both excellent.
Very good food and services
Food was delicious. Bartender was extremely helpful navigating the menu and dining experience. Tough location as not much else in the area, but worth the trip.
Outstanding food, service, and atmosphere.  Everything was excellent but the croquettes, duck, and chocolate cake were sublime.  Insta worthy cocktails.  Can’t wait to go back

Good food, bad service. Reserved a table weeks in advance and had to wait half an hour for it. Hostess told us 15 min into waiting that our “table was midway through dessert”. Cool. Eventually was offered a seat at the bar and got moved to a table. Didn’t really get an apology for making us wait for our table for well beyond our reservation time. Many others were also waiting because of the same issue. So many staff back and forth that it was unclear who our server was. Left us sitting with dirty side plates when our main came and we had to ask for new ones. Wanted dessert, but after waiting 5-10 min for them to clear our plates and 5-10 min for someone to offer us a dessert menu, decided to leave instead. Not sure if they’re overwhelmed by the hype as a result of recent Bon Appetit features, but the front of house has some kinks to work out.  For the price we paid (and as tourists with the dollar being higher here), we really expected better.

In to it. Think I’d return to sit at the bar and eat snacks and desert and drink vermouth. The lovely bartender directed us to an awesome vermouth that paired great with our dessert. This would be a great place to come if you’re dining by yourself because the bar staff is lovely and the bar itself it wide enough to order a couple things comfortably.
Wonderful food, innovative cocktails, and excellent/attentive service. What more can you ask for? Will go back
Love it here,keep coming back for more
They care about what they are creating there.  Delicious and the service is amazing.
Impressive Basque inspired food.
Food was okay but overly overpriced

The space is great and the vibe cool. However, I thought most dishes, with the exception of the meatballs, were extremely mediocre. The steak frites came cold, the salad was boring, and the signature dish, the prosciutto potato chips were beyond underwhelming. At times, I felt like I was eating a bag of Lay’s potato chips with some slices of ham.

Overall a very pleasant experience from the accommodating hostess to the server. The food is high quality. I really enjoyed the appetizer (chips and jamon), as well as the pulpo and the steak. The menu could be a bit more descriptive.

From a chef with experience at Alinea and Frenchette, this haute Basque cuisine is found nestled in Two Bridges, an area of New York that is not frequented too often unless you live in the neighborhood. A short walk from Chinatown or the East Village, the decor is modern yet inviting, and the food is delicious. Portion sizes aren't too big, but that just means you can order plenty and taste a lot. We got the uni tortilla, mushroom and egg, shrimp toast, octopus skewers, iberico and chips, rabbit stew, razor clams with rice - plus dessert: all for 2 people. It was a decent amount of food, but again, the portions aren't too big. The real winner was cocktail: try the Hell in a Hand Basque-ette for a drink that tastes like a delicious health shot. Book it on Resy, because the restaurant fills up fast.  I noticed next door there is an Ernesto's Cafe: didn't see anyone inside but it could perhaps be a good option if the restaurant is all booked out.
Very good foods. But I worried about a little noisy.

One word: exquisite. The food was delicious! Yes, people come for the ham tower, but there were plenty of delicious seafood options for nom-pork eaters - and my vegetarian companion left full and happy! The wine pairing was perfect. The staff incredibly friendly and it had a great atmosphere. Honestly, if you can't get dinner, impress your date and come for wine and dessert.

Really great new Basque restaurant. We had several dishes and loved them all but our favorites were the gildas, the octopus with salsa bravas, and the squid with squid ink. The torrijas for dessert was also incredible - perfectly crispy exterior and super fluffy interior. The wine selection was also fun and diverse, with bottle prices starting around $60 and individual glasses ranging $14-21. Beyond the food, we were both blown away by the service - usually brand new restaurant (especially for first-time restauranteurs) can be spotty while the team figures things out, but the whole crew was super friendly, super attentive, and super knowledgeable of the whole menu. The price can creep up pretty fast so watch how much you order. We'll definitely be back!

It may be that I was just in the Basque Country (Pamplona & Donostia) or because its a new restaurant and they haven't sorted out all of the kinks yet but I found Ernesto’s to be a little underwhelming vs all the hype advertised durning the past few weeks. The food is way overpriced versus its quality. Unfortunately my Tortilla de trufa had an eggshell in it (not a dealbreaker for me). A lot of the food was lukewarm meaning it sat for a while before the staff could serve it. Their cocktails were great. Wine had nyc prices and a caña was 8 dollars which in Spain would be 2 Euros. If you are Spanish you could never justify the prices but if you are living in new york and looking for a good atmosphere maybe its worth checking out.
Great new Basque restaurant in the LES. Definitely worth checking out! Great food and natural wines!
Great food, drinks and staff. It was such a good environment to be with friends
Foie Gras to die for

Ernesto's was amazing – hands down one of the best restaurants I've been to in a long time. The food (entradas, pescados, veraduras...) was phenomenal but the overall experience, from service to the decor and ambience, make the place so so special. The stuffed lamb neck was insanely good and the desserts were equally A+. Not to mention the wines. We got a nice red to compliment our meat dishes. Such a solid restaurant. Can't wait to go back.
The food is excellent and authentic, the staff could not be more courteous and attentive. THE BEST👍
Beautiful space, excellent food, great service and extensive non alcoholic cocktail options.

Five out of five. Came here for the soft opening and everything was amazing. Big shoutout to the lamb stew and the gateaux basque. Also great natural wine list, great service. Sommelier recommended a wine that grew in calcite with dinosaur bones and it was everything
